Job Title: Senior Product Manager for B2B

Location: Seattle, WA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Product Management

Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences. We’re passionate about empowering people to craft beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to building exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

The Opportunity 

Are you passionate about helping marketing teams grow and adapt their unique experiences to engage customers throughout the buying journey? If so, this job is for you!

As a Senior Product Manager on the Adobe Real-Time CDP B2B Edition, you’ll extend Adobe’s industry leading customer data platform for B2B businesses, speeding growth for a large and fast-growing new market for Adobe.

Prepare to apply your creativity, knowledge of competitors, and understanding of customer needs to provide groundbreaking innovations that help brands push the limits of their outstanding customer experiences.

Along the way, you will learn and incorporate sophisticated technology including Adobe Sensei artificial intelligence and machine learning.

What you'll Do 

Conceptualize and develop products and accompanying product strategyWrite detailed product requirement as epics and user stories that allow for efficient development and prioritizationDevelop market mastery by working with customers, industry analysts, partners and othersCollaborate with UX Design team to create mockup and wireframes for product conceptsCollaborate with Research team to solicit user feedback, then review, prioritize, and translate customer feedback into robust product capabilities that delight customersDevelop product documentation, thought leadership, customer presentations and other content assetsCollaborate with product team members and leadership to help ensure a cohesive, integrated product portfolioCollaborate with product marketing and the Adobe field teams to launch the new products / functionality and drive feature adoption and usage. Obsess over solving the most challenging problems of our customers

Formula for success 

Demonstrated knowledge of B2B marketing operations and technologyExtensive experience building Enterprise multi-tenant SaaS solutionsAbility to lead cross-functionally to guide diverging decision-makers and drivers, approvers, and contributors to shared objectives and successful outcomesExceptional communication skills that allow you to work optimally with individuals as diverse as software developers, quality assurance engineers, UX designers, researchers, support specialists, sales representatives, pre-sales and professional services consultants, customer success managers, and operations staffThe presentation skills and confidence to wow a live or virtual audience while educating them at the same time3+ years of product management experience with knowledge of Agile/Scrum development process and the Product Owner roleHands-on experience with customer data platforms and applications such as Adobe Marketo Engage, Salesforce Sales Cloud or Marketing Cloud, and Oracle Eloqua are a plus but not requiredBachelor’s Degree or four years equivalent experience

At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely.

If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer.

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several  U.S. geographic markets, and we pay differently based on those defined markets. The U.S. pay range for this position is $121,800 -- $228,700 annually. Pay within this range varies by work location and may also depend on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for the job location during the hiring process.

At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP).

In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Adobe is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate based on gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law. Learn more.

Adobe aims to make Adobe.com accessible to any and all users. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation to navigate our website or complete the application process, email accommodations@adobe.com or call (408) 536-3015.

Adobe values a free and open marketplace for all employees and has policies in place to ensure that we do not enter into illegal agreements with other companies to not recruit or hire each other’s employees.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
